definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
variant of 濕答答|湿答答[shi1 da1 da1]
variant of 濕答答|湿答答[shi1 da1 da1]

sentences.english: Yes, yesterday was the my pay-day; I pay you the payment today.
sentences.chinese: 是地，昨天是咋哒发薪日，俺今天付给你报酬。

sentences.english: The roosters on the farm say, "Cock-a-doodle-doo. ""
sentences.chinese: 农场里的公鸡说，“咯咯哒。”

sentences.english: The clip-clop of horses' hooves came closer and stopped right in front of the inn.
sentences.chinese: 嘀嘀哒哒的马蹄声越来越近就停在小店门前。

sentences.english: The clip-clop of horses' hooves came closer and stopped right in front of the inn.
sentences.chinese: 嘀嘀哒哒的马蹄声越来越近就停在小店门前。

sentences.english: So God gave him more Erguotou.
sentences.chinese: 于是的上帝给了他更多哒二锅头。

sentences.english: For human-rights activists and sympathizers of the Dalai Lama in Western countries, their actions can be called a failure.
sentences.chinese: 人权份子和西方哒赖的同情者们的举动是失败的。

sentences.english: The key clicked as it turned in the lock.
sentences.chinese: 钥匙在锁孔里转动，发出喀哒的声音。

sentences.english: Cang Li Man's drooling all over the keyboard when looking at the picture.
sentences.chinese: 仓里满看着那张图片，口水哒哒滴，全流在键盘上。

sentences.english: Cang Li Man's drooling all over the keyboard when looking at the picture.
sentences.chinese: 仓里满看着那张图片，口水哒哒滴，全流在键盘上。

sentences.english: Suffering is the most powerful teacher of life.
sentences.chinese: 苦难湜忍生最伟哒得老师。

sentences.english: That clock is ticking for you.
sentences.chinese: 生命的时钟在嘀哒作响。

sentences.english: Ird like to use the very machine that is used in your workshop.
sentences.chinese: 偶想用你们车间用哒那种机器。

sentences.english: There are tongues and actions of humorous scattered in this film.
sentences.chinese: 影片中随时穿插着幽母霈哒语言，行为。

sentences.english: But maybe to put it a slightly different way, they're trolling the waterfront.
sentences.chinese: 但也许稍微转换成不同的方式来说，他们在岸边溜哒。

sentences.english: The gate hooked shut with a click as he left the garden.
sentences.chinese: 他离开园子时将门喀哒一声钩得关上。

definition: phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
(final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
(particle) marker of surprise, sudden realization, reminder
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
dark reddish purple/Internet slang abbr. for 這樣子|这样子[zhe4 yang4 zi5]
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
